page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: The section we are reviewing is one of the most beautiful rural and coastal areas in this part of Scotland. It contains the greater part of {Lunan {Bay}renowned for its stretch of sandy beach which "sings" when walked on. The coast line at the north-east ends in cliffs but the rest ends in sand- hills covered by morran grass. Apart from this ground, the rest of the area is good arable land, six farms having part of their acreage in this section. There are some well established hedges and copses in this undulating country side. The landward area is thinly populated with farm houses and cottages, approximately 100 people living within it.The greatest concentration of population is at Braehead of Lunan, in the village of Lunan where there are six blocks of Dorran-Tarran houses, plus cottages.
